conclusion: Two cars, A and B, are moving in the same direction on a straight highway with given v-t graphs.
In a v-t graph, the slope represents acceleration; positive slope means positive acceleration, negative slope means negative acceleration.
Car A's acceleration magnitude is decreasing over time, and Car B's acceleration magnitude is increasing over time.
Car A starts with a lower velocity and increases its velocity over time, approaching a velocity v2.
Car B starts with a higher velocity and decreases its velocity over time, approaching a lower velocity v1.
Car A's curve should have a decreasing slope, and Car B's curve should have an increasing negative slope.
Car A's curve is concave down, meaning acceleration is decreasing over time.
Car B's curve is concave down, meaning its acceleration magnitude is increasing over time.
The graph aligns with the description of acceleration changes for both cars.
The area under each curve in a v-t graph represents the displacement of the car.
Car A starts at a lower velocity and increases to approach v2; Car B starts at a higher velocity and decreases to approach v1.
To find displacement, calculate the area under the velocity-time curves.
